Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek Wild goat style pottery stemmed dish; interior: greyish cream slip; zigzag pattern on top of rim; incised line at junction with body; two bands at edge of floor; metopal frieze, preserving two tongues and lotus flower with red on kalyx; to centre, part of black band; exterior: black band around edge of rim; reserved on underside with three narrow black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 3, pl. 3, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.578)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Donated to the Museum by the Egypt Exploration Fund
